text.content: Wash spinach leaves and cook them in a covered pan over moderate heat until wilted.
Transfer spinach to a beaker and blend with an immersion blender until creamy. Add whole eggs and a pinch of salt. Mix, then add water and nutmeg.
Gradually add flour and mix with a spoon to incorporate, avoiding lumps. Set the spätzle dough aside.
For the sauce: finely chop chives and cut speck into strips. In a pan, heat butter and oil.
Add speck and sauté for 2-3 minutes until crispy. Pour in cream, chives, season with salt and pepper, and let it thicken over moderate heat until creamy.

To cook spätzle: bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Place a Spätzlehobel over the pot and pour the mixture through the holes, moving the tool back and forth. The spätzle will cook quickly and float to the surface.
Drain spätzle with a slotted spoon directly into the cream and speck sauce. Toss gently for a few moments, season with pepper, and serve hot.
